la.io

Class Data

  • java.lang.Object
    • la.io.Data

  • public class Data
extends java.lang.Object
    A class for a data set where labels are real numbers. If your labels are integers (e.g. classification problems), please use the DataSet class.
    Version:
    1.0 May 3rd, 2015
    Author:
    Mingjie Qian

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int IdxStart
      The starting index for input data.
      Matrix X
      Data matrix (nExample x nFeature).
      double[] Y
      Real number labels.

    • Field Detail

      • IdxStart

        public static int IdxStart
        The starting index for input data. Default value is 1 since LIBSVM and LDA use 1.

      • X

        public Matrix X
        Data matrix (nExample x nFeature).

      • Y

        public double[] Y
        Real number labels.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Data

        public Data()

      • Data

        public Data(Matrix X,
            double[] Y)

    • Method Detail

      • writeDataSet

        public static void writeDataSet(Matrix X,
                                double[] Y,
                                java.lang.String filePath)
        Write a data set to a text file in the LIBSVM format. Note that an empty sparse feature vector will be written as an empty string. Empty sparse vectors commonly occur when a test example only has new features.
        Parameters:
        X - an nExample x nFeature data matrix
        Y - labels
        filePath - file path

      • writeDataSet

        public static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> writeDataSet(Matrix X,
                                                                 double[] Y)
        Write a data set to a string array in the LIBSVM format. Note that an empty sparse feature vector will be written as an empty string. Empty sparse vectors commonly occur when a test example only has new features.
        Parameters:
        X - an nExample x nFeature data matrix
        Y - labels
        Returns:
        a ArrayList<String> instance, each element is a string with LIBSVM data format

      • readDataSetFromStringArray

        public static Data readDataSetFromStringArray(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> feaArray)
                                       throws InvalidInputDataException
        Read a data set from a string array. Note that an empty string will be viewed as an empty sparse feature vector. Empty sparse vectors commonly occur when a test example only has new features.
        Parameters:
        feaArray - a ArrayList<String> instance, each element is a string with LIBSVM data format
        Returns:
        a DataSet instance
        Throws:
        InvalidInputDataException

      • readDataSet

        public static Data readDataSet(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> feaArray)
                        throws InvalidInputDataException
        Read a data set from a string array. Note that an empty string will be viewed as an empty sparse feature vector. Empty sparse vectors commonly occur when a test example only has new features.
        Parameters:
        feaArray - a ArrayList<String> instance, each element is a string with LIBSVM data format
        Returns:
        a DataSet instance
        Throws:
        InvalidInputDataException

      • readDataSetFromFile

        public static Data readDataSetFromFile(java.lang.String filePath)
                                throws java.io.IOException,
                                       InvalidInputDataException
        Read a data set from a LIBSVM formatted file. Note that an empty string will be viewed as an empty sparse feature vector. Empty sparse vectors commonly occur when a test example only has new features. Data format (e.g., index starts from 1):

         +1 1:0.708333 2:1 3:1 4:-0.320755 5:-0.105023 6:-1 7:1 8:-0.419847 9:-1 10:-0.225806 12:1 13:-1 
 -1 1:0.583333 2:-1 3:0.333333 4:-0.603774 5:1 6:-1 7:1 8:0.358779 9:-1 10:-0.483871 12:-1 13:1
        Parameters:
        filePath - file path
        Returns:
        a DataSet instance
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        InvalidInputDataException

      • readDataSet

        public static Data readDataSet(java.lang.String filePath)
                        throws java.io.IOException,
                               InvalidInputDataException
        Read a data set from a LIBSVM formatted file. Note that an empty string will be viewed as an empty sparse feature vector. Empty sparse vectors commonly occur when a test example only has new features. Data format (e.g., index starts from 1):

         +1 1:0.708333 2:1 3:1 4:-0.320755 5:-0.105023 6:-1 7:1 8:-0.419847 9:-1 10:-0.225806 12:1 13:-1 
 -1 1:0.583333 2:-1 3:0.333333 4:-0.603774 5:1 6:-1 7:1 8:0.358779 9:-1 10:-0.483871 12:-1 13:1
        Parameters:
        filePath - file path
        Returns:
        a DataSet instance
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        InvalidInputDataException
